required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cap-assisted Water Immersion Versus Water Immersion Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Cap-assisted Water Immersion Versus Water Immersion Minimal Sedation Colonoscopy - a Prospective, Randomized, Single-center Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Water immersion insertion has been documented to decrease procedure-related discomfort during colonoscopy. Cap attached to the colonoscope tip may improve insertion and shorten cecal intubation time. The investigators would like to assess whether combination of cap-fitted colonoscopy and water immersion insertion is feasible and safe method of diagnostic colonoscopy. The primary endpoint is cecal intubation time and the investigators suppose that the use of cap is able to shorten it significantly. Patient comfort during colonoscope insertion, water consumption, length of the scope while reaching the cecum, need for external compression, need for positioning of the patient and endoscopist´s difficulty with colonoscopy are assessed.

primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint (cecal intubation time) was defined as a time between introduction of the colonoscope into the anus and reaching the cecum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Comfort During Insertion Phase of the Colonoscopy
Success Rate of Minimal Sedation Colonoscopy
secondary_outcome.description: A successful minimal sedation colonoscopy was defined as reaching the cecum without switching to another insertion method and without additional sedation beyond the initial 2 mg of midazolam.

arm_group.description: Cap-fitted colonoscopy using purely water immersion during colonoscope insertion and room air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.
Standard colonoscopy without attached cap using purely water immersion during colonoscope insertion and room air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.

intervention.intervention_name: soft straight distal cap D-201-14304 Olympus attached to the tip of the colonoscope
intervention.description: Colonoscopy with transparent cap attached to the tip of the colonoscope and water immersion during insertion phase and romm air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.
Colonoscopy without transparent cap using water immersion during insertion phase and romm air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- outpatient diagnostic colonoscopy
- bowel prep with macrogolum
- initial 2 mg of midazolam i.v.
- signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- planned therapeutic intervention
- colorectal surgery in history
- known inflammatory bowel disease or colorectal cancer
- refusal of sedation

results_reference.citation: Falt P, Šmajstrla V, Fojtík P, Liberda M, Kliment M, Tvrdík J, Urban O. Cap-assisted water immersion for minimal sedation colonoscopy: prospective, randomized, single-center trial. Dig Endosc. 2013 Jul;25(4):434-9. doi: 10.1111/j.1443-1661.2012.01402.x. Epub 2012 Dec 5.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: recruitment period - between March and May 2012 consecutive patients referred to our endoscopic unit for diagnostic colonoscopy
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: a total of 275 subjects assessed for eligibility a total of 208 patients eandomized after exclusion of 67 due to not fulfilled inclusion criteria a total of 196 subjects analyzed after exclusion of 12 patients (poor bowel preparation, IBD, malignant obstruction, protocol deviation, ischemic colitis)

group.title: Cap-assisted Water Immersion Colonoscopy
group.description: Cap-fitted colonoscopy using purely water immersion during colonoscope insertion and room air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.

group.title: Water Immersion Colonoscopy

outcome.title: Cecal Intubation Time
outcome.description: The primary endpoint (cecal intubation time) was defined as a time between introduction of the colonoscope into the anus and reaching the cecum.
outcome.population: Statistical power was calculated for the primary endpoint. A sample size of 93 subjects per arm was calculated using two-tailed alfa 0.05, beta 0.2, assuming that difference 20 % in intubation times would have been clinically relevant.

group.description: Standard colonoscopy without attached cap using purely water immersion during colonoscope insertion and room air insufflation during colonoscope withdrawal.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: There were no complications recorded in the study.

point_of_contact.organization: Digestive Diseases Center, Vítkovice Hospital, Ostrava, Czech Republic
